roleset.name: suggest

example.name: implied clause
example.text: The statistics imply that three-quarters of blacks approve of Mr. Bush's job performance and 85% of blacks approve of Mrs. Bush.
example.arg: that three-quarters of blacks approve of Mr. Bush's job performance and 85% of blacks approve of Mrs. Bush

example.name: implied NP
example.text: A reintegrated Europe implies big changes in 40-year-old military and economic policies.
example.arg: big changes in 40-year-old military and economic policies

example.name: discourse usage
example.text: As their name implies *trace*-1, [these operations are linked to far-reaching policy reforms that aim at helping borrowing countries get back on the growth path and at enhancing their credit-worthiness]-1.

example.name: with listener
example.text: Mary's behavior implied to John that he was getting lucky that evening.
example.arg: that he was getting lucky that evening

roleset.note: Effectively this should be read as "their name implies that these operations...", but Treebank uniformly does not parse it this way, probably because of the "as". Hence the need for the non-constituent argument.
